definitions: relating to or characteristic of reptiles as a biological class
showing a cold, unfeeling, and calculating nature typical of predatory behavior
examples: The museum displayed various reptilian fossils from prehistory
Her reptilian skin condition required specialized medical treatment
His reptilian gaze made everyone in the room uncomfortable
The politician's reptilian charm concealed his true intentions

definitions: relating to or supporting a system of government without a monarch
relating to or supporting the Republican Party in the United States
examples: The republican movement gained strength after the scandal
Many countries adopted republican forms of government last century
The republican candidate won the primary election decisively
Her republican values influenced her voting patterns significantly

definitions: causing strong feelings of disgust or revulsion in observers
being in conflict with or contradictory to established principles or laws
examples: The jury found the defendant's actions morally repugnant
Such repugnant behavior has no place in society
This clause is repugnant to the constitution's basic principles
The new regulation seems repugnant to established precedent

definitions: arousing intense distaste or disgust through appearance or behavior
having the property of physically pushing away or repelling other objects
examples: The repulsive smell from the garbage made everyone leave
His repulsive manners ruined the elegant dinner party
The repulsive force between like charges prevents them merging
Repulsive magnetic fields keep the particles separated properly

definitions: having a good reputation based on consistent honorable behavior over time
examples: She only buys medicines from reputable pharmacies online
The reputable firm has served the community for decades
We need a reputable contractor for this important project
Only reputable journals were included in the research review

definitions: having been formally or politely asked for by someone with authority
examples: Please submit the requested documents by Friday afternoon
The requested changes have been implemented in the system
All requested items are currently in stock and available
The requested meeting has been scheduled for next week

definitions: officially needed or demanded by rules, laws, or regulations
made necessary by particular circumstances or conditions that must be met
examples: All students must complete the required courses for graduation
The required documentation includes your passport and visa
The job demands the required skills in project management
Meeting the required standards took considerable effort and time

definitions: required as necessary for a particular purpose or situation to succeed
examples: She lacks the requisite experience for senior management positions
The requisite forms must be filed before starting construction
He demonstrated the requisite courage to lead the expedition
Meeting the requisite conditions proved more difficult than expected

definitions: having been saved from a dangerous or distressing situation by intervention
examples: The rescued hikers thanked their brave mountain guides warmly
All rescued animals receive medical care at the shelter
The rescued data proved crucial for completing the project
Rescued artifacts from the site revealed ancient trading patterns

definitions: feeling or expressing bitterness or indignation at unfair treatment
examples: He remained resentful about being passed over for promotion
Her resentful attitude made team collaboration extremely difficult
The resentful employees began looking for other job opportunities
Resentful voters expressed their frustration at the polls

definitions: slow to reveal emotions or opinions, maintaining formal distance with others
kept back or set aside for a particular person or purpose
examples: His reserved manner made him seem aloof at parties
The reserved British gentleman rarely showed his true feelings
These seats are reserved for senior citizens and disabled passengers
The reserved parking spaces require special permits for use

definitions: having been moved to live permanently in a different place or country
examples: The resettled refugees started building new lives in Canada
Resettled communities often maintain their cultural traditions strongly
The resettled families received government assistance for housing needs
Many resettled populations face challenges adapting to new environments

definitions: living somewhere on a long-term or permanent basis as an inhabitant
examples: The resident population has grown significantly this past decade
Resident students must follow dormitory rules and regulations
She's been a resident physician at the hospital since June
The resident birds stay here throughout the winter months

definitions: designed for people to live in, consisting mainly of private houses
examples: The residential neighborhood was quiet and tree-lined throughout
New residential developments are planned for the suburban area
Residential customers pay different utility rates than businesses do
The residential zone prohibits commercial activities and industrial uses

definitions: remaining after the greater part or quantity has been removed or used
examples: The residual heat from the engine warmed the garage
Residual pesticides on produce concern many health-conscious consumers
The patient experienced residual pain after surgery ended completely
Residual income continues flowing after the initial work stops

definitions: able to recover quickly from difficulties, setbacks, or traumatic experiences
able to spring back into shape after bending, stretching, or compression
examples: The resilient economy bounced back after the financial crisis
Children are remarkably resilient in adapting to change
The resilient material returns to its original shape quickly
This resilient flooring withstands heavy foot traffic exceptionally well

definitions: containing resin or having the sticky, aromatic qualities characteristic of resin
examples: The resinous pine scent filled the forest after rainfall
Resinous wood burns longer but produces more creosote buildup
The wine had a distinctly resinous flavor from aging
Resinous substances sealed the ancient Egyptian sarcophagus effectively

definitions: able to withstand the damaging effect or force of something harmful
opposed to or unwilling to accept something such as change or new ideas
examples: This fabric is resistant to water and stain damage
The bacteria became resistant to multiple antibiotic treatments
Management remained resistant to implementing the proposed changes immediately
Some students are resistant to new teaching methods initially

definitions: having the property of electrical resistance, impeding the flow of current
examples: The resistive heating element warmed the room efficiently
Resistive touchscreens require pressure to register input properly
The resistive load affects the circuit's overall performance significantly
Engineers selected resistive materials for the heating application

definitions: admirably purposeful, determined, and unwavering in purpose or belief
examples: She remained resolute despite facing numerous obstacles and setbacks
The resolute leader inspired confidence in the troubled times
His resolute defense of principles earned widespread respect nationally
The team showed resolute determination to win the championship

definitions: firmly determined to do something despite difficulties or opposition
having been settled or found a solution to a problem or dispute
examples: She was resolved to complete her education despite hardships
The committee remained resolved to implement the new policy
The resolved dispute allowed both parties to move forward
All technical issues have been resolved by the engineering team

definitions: producing a deep, clear, reverberating sound that continues vibrating
evoking or suggesting strong images, memories, or emotions in people
examples: His resonant voice filled the cathedral during the service
The resonant tones of the cello moved the audience deeply
The poem's resonant themes speak to universal human experiences
Her speech contained resonant messages about justice and equality

definitions: producing or filled with continuing sound through sustained vibration
continuing to have a powerful effect or influence on people
examples: The resonating strings created beautiful harmonic overtones throughout
A resonating chamber amplifies the instrument's natural sound
Her resonating words inspired a generation of activists worldwide
The resonating impact of the decision continues affecting policy

definitions: unmistakably clear, emphatic, or complete in effect or result
producing a loud, deep, reverberating or echoing sound
examples: The election was a resounding victory for the incumbent party
The proposal met with resounding approval from all members
A resounding crash came from the kitchen downstairs suddenly
The resounding applause lasted for several minutes after performance

definitions: having the ability to find quick and clever ways to overcome difficulties
examples: The resourceful engineer fixed the machine using everyday items
Resourceful students find creative ways to complete challenging projects
She proved remarkably resourceful in stretching the limited budget
The resourceful team overcame every obstacle they encountered successfully

definitions: regarded by society as being good, proper, and worthy of respect
adequate or acceptable in size, amount, or quality though not outstanding
examples: They lived in a respectable neighborhood near the downtown
She comes from a respectable family with strong values
The company posted respectable profits despite economic challenges
He earned a respectable score on the difficult examination

definitions: admired and held in high esteem by others for achievements or qualities
examples: The respected professor received numerous awards for her research
He became a respected member of the local community
The respected journal published groundbreaking scientific discoveries regularly
She sought advice from respected experts in the field

definitions: showing polite respect and consideration for others' feelings and rights
examples: The students maintained respectful behavior during the ceremony
She gave a respectful nod to acknowledge his presence
Please keep a respectful distance from the artwork displayed
The debate remained respectful despite strongly differing opinions

definitions: belonging or relating separately to each of two or more people or things
examples: The students returned to their respective classrooms after assembly
Each department head manages their respective teams and budgets
The winners received their respective trophies at the ceremony
They went their respective ways after the meeting ended

definitions: relating to or affecting the organs and processes involved in breathing
examples: The patient developed severe respiratory complications requiring immediate attention
Respiratory diseases affect millions of people worldwide each year
The respiratory system includes the lungs, airways, and diaphragm
She specialized in treating respiratory infections in children

definitions: attractive and impressive through being richly colorful or brilliantly shining
examples: The bride looked resplendent in her ivory silk gown
The resplendent sunrise painted the mountains in golden hues
The palace rooms were resplendent with gold and crystal
He appeared resplendent in his military dress uniform

definitions: a person who responds or replies to something, especially a survey participant
examples: The respondent pool included people from diverse demographic backgrounds
Each respondent received compensation for completing the lengthy questionnaire
Survey respondent data was kept strictly confidential throughout research
The respondent rate exceeded expectations for the online poll

definitions: having an obligation to do something or being accountable for one's actions
being the primary cause of something and able to be blamed or credited
showing good judgment and ability to be trusted with important matters
examples: The manager is responsible for all department operations daily
Parents are responsible for their children's welfare and education
The storm was responsible for widespread power outages yesterday
This gene is responsible for determining eye color
She's a responsible teenager who always completes her obligations
We need responsible citizens to volunteer for community service

definitions: reacting quickly and positively to requests, suggestions, or changing conditions
examples: The responsive customer service team resolved issues within hours
The new website design is highly responsive to user needs
The responsive touch screen registers even the lightest taps
Markets were responsive to the central bank's policy changes

definitions: having had sufficient rest or sleep to feel refreshed and energetic
examples: The rested athletes performed significantly better in competition today
She felt rested after the long weekend vacation break
A rested mind makes better decisions than a tired one
The rested troops were ready for the next mission

definitions: having a quiet and soothing quality that provides rest and relaxation
examples: The restful atmosphere of the spa helped guests unwind
She enjoyed a restful vacation at the mountain retreat
The bedroom's restful colors promote better sleep at night
Soft music created a restful ambiance in the waiting room

definitions: unable to remain still or quiet, especially because of boredom or dissatisfaction
examples: The restive horse refused to stand still for grooming
Students grew restive during the lengthy graduation ceremony yesterday
The restive crowd began demanding immediate action from officials
Workers became increasingly restive under the new management policies

definitions: unable to rest or relax due to anxiety, boredom, or eagerness
examples: The restless child couldn't sit still during the movie
She spent a restless night worrying about the interview
His restless energy drove him to start multiple projects
The restless sea churned under the approaching storm clouds

definitions: having the ability to restore health, strength, or well-being to someone
examples: The restorative powers of sleep cannot be underestimated ever
She found the mountain air restorative after city living
Restorative yoga helps heal both body and mind naturally
The spa offered various restorative treatments for stressed executives

definitions: characterized by showing careful self-control in expression of emotions or actions
physically prevented from moving or acting freely by external force
examples: His restrained response to criticism showed remarkable self-control
The restrained color palette created an elegant interior design
The restrained prisoner couldn't escape from the secure facility
The dog had to be restrained during the veterinary examination

definitions: limited in access to authorized people only for security or privacy
limited in extent, number, scope, or action by rules or circumstances
examples: The restricted area requires special clearance to enter legally
Restricted documents contain classified information about national security
The restricted diet eliminated all processed foods and sugar
Parking is restricted to residents only on this street

definitions: putting limitations or controls on the size, amount, or range of something
examples: The restricting regulations limited business growth opportunities significantly
Restricting access to certain websites protects children online
The tight collar was restricting his breathing during exercise
These restricting policies prevent innovation in the tech sector

definitions: imposing restrictions or limitations on someone's activities or freedom
examples: The restrictive dress code upset many students and parents
These restrictive laws limit freedom of expression and assembly
The contract contains highly restrictive clauses about competition
Her parents' restrictive rules made teenage life very difficult

definitions: occurring or produced as a result or consequence of something
examples: The resultant damage from the flood exceeded initial estimates
Resultant confusion led to several mistakes being made unfortunately
The resultant vector represents the sum of all forces
Her resultant anxiety required professional therapeutic intervention eventually

definitions: increasing or reviving after a period of little activity or decline
examples: The resurgent economy showed strong growth in all sectors
Resurgent nationalism became a concern for international relations
The team's resurgent performance thrilled fans after recent losses
There's been resurgent interest in traditional crafts and skills

definitions: brought back to consciousness or life from apparent death or unconsciousness
examples: The resuscitated patient made a full recovery within weeks
Paramedics successfully resuscitated victims at the accident scene
The resuscitated company emerged stronger after near bankruptcy
A resuscitated interest in classical music surprised industry experts

definitions: continued to have something or keep it in one's possession or use
examples: The retained earnings will fund future expansion projects entirely
All retained documents must be stored securely and properly
She retained control of the company despite pressure selling
The retained lawyer will represent us in court proceedings

definitions: done as revenge or punishment in response to harm or injury received
examples: The retaliatory strikes escalated the conflict between the nations
Companies face lawsuits for retaliatory firing of whistleblowers
The government imposed retaliatory tariffs on imported goods yesterday
Retaliatory measures were taken after the trade agreement violation

definitions: not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily, especially about something sensitive
examples: He remained reticent about his plans for the future
The normally reticent witness finally agreed to testify publicly
She was reticent to discuss her personal life with colleagues
The company stayed reticent regarding the merger negotiations details

definitions: relating to the retina, the light-sensitive layer at the back of the eye
examples: The retinal scan provides highly secure biometric identification
Retinal detachment requires immediate medical attention to prevent blindness
The doctor examined her retinal blood vessels for damage
Advanced retinal imaging revealed early signs of disease progression
